3.1.1 - Set out extents of fill and check against design
Conformance Criteria - Consistency with Construction Drawings
3.1.2 - Ensure GPS plant have the correct model set up in machine and that a datum is available for checking
Conformance Criteria - Consistency with Construction Drawings

3.1.3 - Ensure the complete removal of all organics, topsoil, Vegetation, and roots. The depth of topsoil stripping should be adequate to eliminate all organic material, turf, and significant plant roots.
Test frequency - Immediately prior to earthworks beginning in all Fill areas
Conformance Criteria - Construction team shall coordinate with the Designer ahead of and during clearing and stripping operations to determine the stripping depth.
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Daily Site Report by Design Site Representative
3.1.4 - Designer witness of in-situ subgrade prior to filling

Conformance Criteria - Before fill is placed in any area, the Constructor shall notify the Designer that the fill foundation has been stripped and drained, and is ready for the Designer’s inspection and approval.
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Daily Site Report by Design Site Representative
Conformance Criteria - Where shown on the drawings.
○ The Designer will specify the depth of the undercut in materials.
○ The Constructor shall treat any excavated undercut material as landscape fill or unsuitable.
○ Inspection to cover the benching into the exisiting ground around the undercut.
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Daily Site Report by Design Site Representative
Specifications and Standards - IFC drawings and MMA-DES-GEO-E1-SPC-3859
Method/Description - Visual inspection of directional placement, panel length, laps, and damage
Test frequency - During basal reinforcement installation and every 100m² of geotextile installed.
Conformance Criteria - Ensure geogrid used is the correct type, undamaged, and directional placement, tensioning, laps, and spacing are correct
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Geotextile Installation Checksheet
Conformance Criteria - Subsoils drains to be checked that they are being installed as per the earthworks specification and drawings
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Subsoil Installation Checklist
Test frequency - Structural Fill - 1 test per material type per fill
○ MSE Fill - 1 test per material type per fill
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Test report
3.2.8 - insitu fill testing-In situ moisture content and density
Method/Description - In situ moisture content and density
Test frequency - Structural Fill - 1 test per 1 m lift per 100m length, Heavy compaction and standard compaction areas outlined in RFI00057
○ MSE Fill - 1 test per 1 m lift per 100m length
○ GAP 65 - 4 tests per 1 m lift per 100m length
Conformance Criteria - Structural Fill - average > 95% MDD All tests > 92%,
○ MSE Fill - Average > 95% MDD All tests > 25%,
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Test report
○ Structural fill - 1 test per layer per 100m
○ MSE Fill - 1 Test per layer per 100m
Conformance Criteria - MSE Fill - The number of blows per 100mm to drive the scala penetrometer from a depth of 100 to 1000mm below the fill surface shall not be less than 5
○ Structural fill - The number of blows per 100mm to drive the scala penetrometer from a depth of 100 to 1000mm below the fill surface shall not be less than 5

Test frequency - During construction and at end
Conformance Criteria - Ensure all features and buried items are captured.
